recipes.author: diana
ingredients: ½ a can of condensed milk
1 small can of prunes in sugar syrup
½ a wheel of guava marmalade
[Icing] ½ a can of condensed milk
instructions: Make a prune compote by pitting the plums and taking them to a stovetop to boil together with the syrup and 150 grams of sugar, and set aside.
Dissolve the guava marmalade in half a cup of water, adding an optional tablespoon of sweet Martini if desired, then take it to the stovetop to boil. Set aside.

Mix the butter with the sugar; then mix in the egg yolks, beating well. Next add the flour with the 3 teaspoons of baking powder mixed in, and don’t stop mixing. Add the condensed milk, then half the prune compote and half the goiabada. Lastly, mix in the egg whites (beaten to stiff peaks).
Roast in a buttered and floured rectangular oven pan. The remaining goiabada and prune compote will serve as a filling for the pie.

recipes.author: diana
instructions: Knead all the ingredients together and shape the resulting dough into small round pieces.
Cook in a pot with boiling salted water. When the pieces float to the surface, they’re done cooking.
Serve with sauces, meat, fish or shrimp.

recipes.author: diana
instructions: A day in advance, place the raisins in wine to soak.
Cut the bread in thin slices and let it soak in warm milk. Strain after an hour.
Knead the bread, adding the eggs, cheese, raisins, butter, cinnamon and clove. Add sugar to taste.
Butter and flour the pan with a mixture of flour and cinnamon. Bake in a double boiler in a moderate oven.

recipes.author: lyscia
instructions: Blend the ingredients together and pour into a caramelised oven pan.
Bake with a double boiler in a moderately hot oven.
Chill for at least six hours.

recipes.author: claudia
instructions: In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites to soft peaks.
Mix well the butter and sugar, followed by the yolks, beating everything together to a uniform-looking cream.
Gradually add the flour and milk. Lastly, the baking powder and parmesan cheese.
Gently mix in the egg whites with a wooden spoon.
For a quick icing, mix one egg yolk, half a can of condensed milk, one tablespoon of butter and 3 tablespoons of chocolate powder, and mix on the stovetop till it reaches the desired texture.

recipes.author: yvonne
ingredients: 1 cup of milk or orange juice
3 cups of flour (or 2 flour and 1 cornstarch)
instructions: In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites to soft peaks.
Mix together the sugar, butter and eggs. Slowly add the flour and milk. Baking powder goes in last.
Gently mix in the egg whites with a wooden spoon.

recipes.author: andre
ingredients: Half a bottle of cachaça or rum
instructions: Make about a litre’s worth of passionfruit juice, sweetened to taste.
Mix in the remaining ingredients and blend well.
Serve with ice

recipes.author: claudia
instructions: Make a prune compote with the correct amount of water and sugar for a thick texture. Allow to cool to room temperature.
Beat the butter with the sugar until fluffy, then add in the yolks, the prune compote, the coke, the flower (already mixed with baking powder).
Carefully mix in the egg whites (beaten to stiff peaks).
For the icing, mix everything constantly over a stovetop till it boils. Cover the cake and fill in the middle as well.

recipes.author: diana
instructions: Put all of the sugar through a fine sieve.
Beat the egg whites to very stiff peaks.
Slowly add in the sugar, mixing well. When the mixture thickens, start adding in the lemon juice.
Keep mixing and adding sugar till it reaches the correct consistency (turn the bowl upside down – it’s ready if it doesn’t run).

recipes.author: diana
ingredients: ½ a cup of olive oil
instructions: Blend everything together, then spread over a buttered pizza pan. Save half for later.
Cover with desired toppings, then spread the rest of the dough.
Bake and serve while it’s still hot.

recipes.author: lara
instructions: Dissolve the yeast in a bit of warm milk.
Add in the flour, the beaten eggs, milk, sugar, salt and butter.
Knead well and let rise.
Shape the buns, filling with diced ham & cheese if desired. One may also add raisins.
Brush with beaten egg yolk and let rise some more, then bake in a hot oven.

recipes.author: lara
instructions: Cook every ingredient in group [1] till the skin on the tomatoes starts to peel off.
Blend with a small cup of water, and sieve.
The result will be a thin paste. Gradually add in group [2] and the butter, take to a stovetop and let thicken. Lastly, add in the cheese.

recipes.author: claudia
instructions: Mix the butter and sugar well until the mixture is fluffy.
Add the yolks and, mixing constantly, gradually add the other ingredients.
Lastly, fold in the egg whites (beaten to stiff peaks).
Bake in a large cake pan, or in three separate pie pans and stack with filling in between each piece.
For the filling, mix everything together and take to a stovetop to thicken.

recipes.author: diana
instructions: Blend all ingredients except for the cream and the goiabada.
Pour the mixture into a deep enough oven-safe dish. Bake in the oven, then allow to cool.
Whip the cream with 2 tablespoons of sugar and pour over the baked batter.
Lastly, melt the goiabada with 2 tablespoons of water and delicately pour over the layer of cream.
Chill for a few hours before serving.

recipes.author: terezapacheco
instructions: Beat the butter and sugar well, then add in the eggs one by one.
Gradually add in the flour and baking powder, previously mixed and sieved.
Pour into a buttered and dusted cake pan.

Melt the goiabada in a splash of white wine, then spread it on top of the batter. Cover it with a layer of shredded coconut and pour the condensed milk on top. Finally, dust with the powdered parmesan and bake.
Cut in a cross-pattern, can be served in individual candy cups.
